$interpreted: Morris: Ancient Seed.
Morris: 23.487 gram Crystal.
Morris: Clovis, the Soul Energy item you made yesterday...
Clio: Professor Dietrich, Clovis hasn't come back yet. Did you forget you sent him to Whistlewood valley to find something?
Morris: Ah, Fournier. When did you get here?
Clio: I've been here the whole time.
Morris: Well, then why hasn't he...*yawn*...
Clio: Professor, have you been staying up these past couple nights? I know you've got a conference but...
Morris: I've no time to sleep...and there's too much work to deal with.
Clio: I may not be as capable or as trusted by Professor as Clovis, but I'm sure I can help with the minor things, like organizing the data.
Morris: Fair enough. I believe people ought to be used appropriately.
Clio: I'll take that as a compliment. Thank you, Professor.
Morris: ...*yawn*...
Clio: (All this information is public...Looks like the Life Magic sect isn't aware of the Dracotines' existence.)
Clio: (But then who is secretly contacting the Dracotines from within the Academy...?)
Aosta: Clio Fournier, what are you doing?
Clio: Professor Dietrich wants me to help him organize the data from today's experiment.
Aosta: Why would the professor ask for your help...?
Clio: Who knows? Maybe it's because you're not the only assistant here.
Clio: Or perhaps it's because you took too long to come back?
Aosta: No one is more familiar with Professor Dietrich's work than I am. Let me take care of this. I don't want you messing anything up.
Clio: ...You're more than welcome to take over. Thanks.

Clio: That stunt the Applied Magic folks pulled this morning, while it was indeed amusing and fairly enjoyable to watch... 
We certainly can't afford to make the same mistake at the conference three days from now.
Aosta: Professor Dietrich would never make such a stupid mistake! Are you insulting the professor!?
Clio: Sorry, sorry. I didn't mean anything by it～
Aosta: The research results that the Professor reveals at the conference will definitely shut those buffoons in Applied Magic up...
Clio: Shhh!
Clio: It's rather late. Why don't you show yourself and have a little chat with us?
Aosta: Where do you think you're going?
Barbara: Let me go! You're hurting me!
Aosta: You're the new freshman, aren't you? What are you eavesdropping on us for?
Barbara: Who said anything about eavesdropping? I was just passing by!
Clio: We've already seen her face. She's not going anywhere. Let her go, Clovis.
Aosta: ......
Barbara: Me? Eavesdropping? How rude! I was just...
Barbara: ...curious about what the Life Magic people are researching.
Aosta: You have no shame, do you? Do you realize how sublime the Professor's research is──
Clio: Okay, okay. Look at her, you've totally freaked her out with that scary look of yours.
Aosta: You think this is scary!?
Clio: Girl, what's your name?
Barbara: ...Barbara. My name's Barbara Balzac. I'm Duke Balzac's youngest daughter.
Aosta: Duke Balzac...
Clio: Barbara, don't sneak out of the dorms in the middle of the night again. Otherwise...you'll make some upperclassmen very angry.
Aosta: This will not do. We must let the professor deal with her.
Clio: Is it really that serious? Plus, the professor is resting...
Aosta: Daughter of Balzac, your response?
Clio: ...Fine. Do what you wish.
Barbara: Ou...Ouch! Let me go! Where are you taking me?
Clio: Clovis, don't be so rough with her!
